text: Agnidra corticata is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Warren in 1922. It is found in north-eastern India and China (Sichuan). The wingspan is 15.5-18.5 mm for males and 17.5–19 mm for females. Adults are similar to Agnidra vinacea and Agnidra fuscilinea, but have a much smaller area of pale patches at the end of the cell on the forewings. These patches are pale buff.Bull. Br. Mus. nat. Hist. (Ent.) Suppl. 12 ==Subspecies== *Agnidra corticata corticata (north-eastern India) *Agnidra corticata francki Watson, 1968 (China: Sichuan) ==References== Category:Moths described in 1922 Category:Drepaninae Category:Moths of China Category:Moths of India
title: Agnidra corticata
